FuncDef:
The whitelist session-car radius command configures the session CAR parameters for the RADIUS whitelist.
The undo whitelist session-car radius command restores the default configuration.
By default, the CIR, PIR, CBS, and PBS of session CAR for the RADIUS whitelist are 512 Kbit/s, 1500 Kbit/s, 125000 bytes, and 250000 bytes, respectively.
CLIs: whitelist session-car radius { cir <cir-value> | pir <pir-value> | cbs <cbs-value> | pbs <pbs-value> } *
undo whitelist session-car radius [ cir <cir-value> | pir <pir-value> | cbs <cbs-value> | pbs <pbs-value> ] *

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the CIR.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 1000000, in Kbit/s. The default value is 512.

Specifies the PIR.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 1000000, in Kbit/s. The default value is 1500. The value of pir-value must be greater than or equal to the value of cir-value.

Specifies the CBS.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 9000000, in bytes. The default value is 125000.

Specifies the PBS.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 9000000, in bytes. The default value is 250000. The value of pbs-value must be greater than or equal to the value of cbs-value.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the default session CAR parameter settings do not meet RADIUS service requirements, run the whitelist session-car radius command to manually adjust the session CAR parameters for the RADIUS whitelist.
